title.narrative: République arabe syrienne (la): Aide ciblée aux pays
Syrian Arab Republic: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Inequalities within existing service delivery models identified.

target.value: a) Support to identifying inequalities within existing service delivery models (availability of immunization services; quality of micro plans) and Implementation of key recommendation from the Equity assessment supported under 2019/2020 PEF TCA; b) Support EPI Coverage Evaluation to provide information as a basis for making concrete recommendations, and planning for improving routine immunization activities to improve coverage rates and reduce equity barriers to immunisation services at the natioanl, governoratres and districtes levels.

comment.narrative: ? Identified as reflected in the final report of CEA

title.narrative: The ECE report is avalible and EPI Coverage Evaluvaion (ECE) findings and priority interventions identified in different critical program areas are available for PSR and HSS application development .

target.value: a) Support to identifying inequalities within existing service delivery models (availability of immunization services; quality of micro plans) and Implementation of key recommendation from the Equity assessment supported under 2019/2020 PEF TCA; b) Support EPI Coverage Evaluation to provide information as a basis for making concrete recommendations, and planning for improving routine immunization activities to improve coverage rates and reduce equity barriers to immunisation services at the natioanl, governoratres and districtes levels.

comment.narrative: ? The final report is attached but still two annexes that the MoH is keen to add. The first one is done already as being the cross tabulation of vaccination coverage per the determinants (by governorate) and the second one was promised in the final meeting by the CBS to produce the analysis per district which is of value.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Demand Promotion (DP) and community engagement (CE) plans ar developed .

target.value: Based on the finding and recommendation of KAP assessment conducted under 2019/2020 PEF TCA support MOH: i) To finalize PSR/HSS proposal: ii) Revise/develop communication plan of action for RI and campaigs; iii) Develop Demand Promotion (DP) and community engagement (CE) plans.

comment.narrative: ? An overall Communication for Routine Immunization framework has been agreed with MoH - 2021 micro plans for Demand promotion and community engagement have been planned and prepared with DoHs in all governorates and endorsed by MoH at the central level.

target.value: Based on the finding and recommendation of KAP assessment conducted under 2019/2020 PEF TCA support MOH: i) To finalize PSR/HSS proposal: ii) Revise/develop communication plan of action for RI and campaigs; iii) Develop Demand Promotion (DP) and community engagement (CE) plans.

comment.narrative: ? An overall Communication for Routine Immunization framework has been agreed with MoH - 2021 micro plans for Demand promotion and community engagement have been planned and prepared with DoHs in all governorates and endorsed by MoH at the central level.

title.narrative: Capacity development of key stakeholders, including health care providers, FLW on Interpersonal communication and community mobilization skills, media campaign and engagement with influential people conducted to educate, engage and empower communities with knowledge and skills importance of immunization in 12 districts of low coverage and zero dose at governorate level

target.value: Based on the finding and recommendation of KAP assessment conducted under 2019/2020 PEF TCA support MOH: i) To implement communication plan activities for RI and campaign in the PSR/HSS proposal: ii) Develop Demand Promotion (DP) and community engagement (CE) plans at the national and governorate levels.

comment.narrative: A national exercise was run and facilitated at all departments of health in close collaboration with MoH to develop Routine Immunization Strengthening plans for all 14 governorates with focus on areas with low coverage and high dropout rates. The plans were later operationalized as per the need and relevance such as in North East and Aleppo. Key planning documents are available and can be accessed on this link; the compiled plan is attached below.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
Considering assessment findings, 6 out of 48 rehabilitation of health facilities

target.value: Technical support in the assessment 48 listed health facilities for slight rehabilitation & solarization as reflected in PSR/HSS proposal (activiteis14 & 15)

comment.narrative: ? Due to full engagement of DoH and MoH with COVAX related activities and transfer of funds to country was delayed till June 2021'.

target.value: Technical support in the assessment 48 listed health facilities for slight rehabilitation & solarization as reflected in PSR/HSS proposal (activiteis14 & 15)

comment.narrative: work has been initiated with MoH to undertake the assessment before end of the year and prepare the list of facilities requiring rehabilitation awaiting arrival of HSS resources to start the actual work on rehabilitation. Tools and questionnaire for the assessment have been developed/adapted for the assessment and ready for deployment. The delay has been due to the competing priorities from COVID-19 vaccine roll out and also due to limited HR at UNICEF CO (departure of the EPI specialist), the assessment for these facilities has been delayed to later time this year as MoH counterparts at the national and governorate level are occupied with ongoing COVID-19 vaccine deployment

title.narrative: Developing MR campaign plan,RI micro plans, and tools, as well as establishing monitoring system,

target.value: Technical support in planning and implementing MR campaign and CEA recommendations related activities as reflected in the PSR/HSS proposal and ensure: i) effective initiation of implementation of identified inequalities within existing service delivery models (availability of immunization services; quality of micro plans) and Implementation of key recommendation from the Equity assessment supported under 2019/2020 PEF TCA; ii) Detailed districts/governorates micro plans for improving routine immunization activities that aim to address zero-dose children and to improve coverage rates and reduce equity barriers to immunization services at the national, governorates and districts levels.

comment.narrative: ? MR Campaign framework for the plan of action is in place. MR Micro plans has not been fully prepared; this to be initiated with MoH in the last quarter of 2021. IEC materials are available and requires tailoring to the set dates and locations of the vaccination activities

title.narrative: Implementation of key recommendation from the Equity assessment upon the finalization of the final report in the first quarter 2021.

target.value: Technical support in planning and implementing MR campaign and CEA recommendations related activities as reflected in the PSR/HSS proposal and ensure: i) effective initiation of implementation of identified inequalities within existing service delivery models (availability of immunization services; quality of micro plans) and Implementation of key recommendation from the Equity assessment supported under 2019/2020 PEF TCA; ii) Detailed districts/governorates micro plans for improving routine immunization activities that aim to address zero-dose children and to improve coverage rates and reduce equity barriers to immunization services at the national, governorates and districts levels.

comment.narrative: It has been challenging for MoH staff at national and governorate level to find time to implement some of the strategic interventions for strengthening RI services due to the overwhelming situation in2021 and COVAX work. This activity is to be undertaken as part of the overall country plan for the zero dose and reaching the unreached.

title.narrative: Implementation research designed, tools developed, and data collection started in 12 districts of low coverage and zero dose at governorate level

target.value: Technical support to i) Conduct study on knowledge, attitudes and behaviors towards vaccination ii) Conduct focus group discussions to identify community barriers to service access and utilization as reflected in PSR/HSS proposal (activities 19 & 22)

comment.narrative: MoH has been shifting focus to COVID 19 Vaccination and giving the high number of studies suggested to MoH and based on their prioritization criteria, the Routine Immunization KAP and FGDs are postponed to a later stage mostly early 2022. A quantitative rapid assessment for COVID 19 vaccination has been conducted however between September and October 2021 targeting vaccine eligible population and health workers. The report is ready and currently under review by MoH and UNICEF concerned officials. MoH team has been trained on data collection, entry and analysis as part of this exercise which would benefit the RI research once agreed on its timeline.

title.narrative: Considering assessment findings, 12 out of 48 rehabilitation of health facilities

target.value: Technical support in the assessment 48 listed health facilities for slight rehabilitation & solarization as reflected in PSR/HSS proposal (activiteis14 & 15)

comment.narrative: work has been initiated with MoH to undertake the assessment before end of the year and prepare the list of facilities requiring rehabilitation awaiting arrival of HSS resources to start the actual work on rehabilitation. Tools and questionnaire for the assessment have been developed/adapted for the assessment and ready for deployment. The delay has been due to the competing priorities from COVID-19 vaccine roll out and also due to limited HR at UNICEF CO (departure of the EPI specialist), the assessment for these facilities has been delayed to later time this year as MoH counterparts at the national and governorate level are occupied with ongoing COVID-19 vaccine deployment.

title.narrative: WHO : Human Resources for Health
Staff recruited

target.value: WHO Staff recruitment Damascus hub to provide technical support to all proposed activities, including implementation of all Gavi-related activities

comment.narrative: Staff in place

target.value: WHO Staff recruitment for Gaziantep hub to provide technical support to all proposed activities, including implementation of all Gavi-related activities

comment.narrative: Staff in place

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
EVM cIP for first half year 2021 key priority actions are implemented and temperature mapping studies at the governorates level done as reflected in the PSR/HSS proposal

target.value: Technical support in implementing EVMA recommendation and improvement plan from 2019//2020 PEF TCA and ensure: i) EVM cIP for next 18 months key priority actions are implemented as reflected in PSR/HSS proposal; ii) effective initiation of implementation of EVM cIP; iii) temperature mapping studies at the governorates.

comment.narrative: ? The key priority actions of EVM cIP are implemented and the temperature mapping studies at the governorates level not done yet due to DoH staff fully engaged with COVAX related activities and will be done in the 2nd half of the year 2021

target.value: Technical support in implementing EVMA recommendation and improvement plan from 2019//2020 PEF TCA and ensure: i) EVM cIP for next 18 months key priority actions are implemented as reflected in PSR/HSS proposal; ii) effective initiation of implementation of EVM cIP; iii) temperature mapping studies at the governorates.

comment.narrative: There have been many competing priorities in the year 2021. One of these is that the Ministry of Health has been overwhelmed with COVAX and COVID19 vaccine roll out. However, UNICEF CO has finalised the recruitment of an international supply chain consultant to support this thematic areas and he is expected to start his assignment in Mid-November and will start leading the work on supply chain related work for both RI and COVAX businesses. The temperature mapping study will be one of the first priority actions to undertake.

title.narrative: EVM cIP for second half year 2021 key priority actions are implemented and temperature mapping studies at the governorates level done as reflected in the PSR/HSS proposal

target.value: Technical support in implementing EVMA recommendation and improvement plan from 2019//2020 PEF TCA and ensure: i) EVM cIP for next 18 months key priority actions are implemented as reflected in PSR/HSS proposal; ii) effective initiation of implementation of EVM cIP; iii) temperature mapping studies at the governorates.

comment.narrative: There have been many competing priorities in the year 2021. One of these is that the Ministry of Health has been overwhelmed with COVAX and COVID-19 vaccine roll out. However, UNICEF CO has finalised the recruitment of an international supply chain consultant to support this thematic area and he is expected to start in Mid-November and will start leading the work on supply chain related work for both RI and COVAX businesses. The temperature mapping study will be one of the first priority actions to undertake

M/R 5 years strategic plan developed

comment.narrative: MR 5 years strategic plan was developed in June 2021. The workshop conducted during 8-9 June 2021, to review the plan with other departments and focal points at governorate levels. The plan was discussed with partners on the 10 of June.

Data desk review or triangulation analysis performed (coverage, surveillance, operational, others)

Available Supply cold chain Routine EPI, SIAs activities and communication MORE C4D data in Northwest Syria to inform donors & program on interventaion of impact of cold chain activities and communcaiton related activities

comment.narrative: ? Due to MoH staff full engagement with COVAX related activities the review was not conducted and it will be done in the 2nd half year 2021.

title.narrative: In-depth assessement of data quality (DQR, DQA, audit) performed

target.value: Available Supply cold chain Routine EPI, SIAs activities and communication MORE C4D data in Northwest Syria to inform donors & program on interventaion of impact of cold chain activities and communcaiton related activities

comment.narrative: a). Data quality assessment is being delayed due to lack of expertise in this field inside NWS. b).UNICEF will rely on SIG to identify independent party to perform DQA for NWS.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Health Financing/Sustainability
Immunisation costing study carried out by MOH/EPI (country-led, with a capacity building component)

target.value: a) Support to identifying inequalities within existing service delivery models (availability of immunization services; quality of micro plans) and Implementation of key recommendation from the Equity assessment supported under 2021/2022 PEF TCA; b) Support EPI Coverage Evaluation to provide information as a basis for making concrete recommendations, and planning for improving routine immunization activities to improve coverage rates and reduce equity barriers to immunisation services at the natioanl, governoratres and districtes levels.

comment.narrative: ? Due to some administrative structure changes in MOH (EPI Manager is promoted to PHC Director position, and EPI stuff were fully engaged with COVAX training, planning and monitoring) and they have no time to work on other activities. In the second half of the yare 2021 the immunization costing study will be carried out..

target.value: a) Support to identifying inequalities within existing service delivery models (availability of immunization services; quality of micro plans) and Implementation of key recommendation from the Equity assessment supported under 2021/2022 PEF TCA; b) Support EPI Coverage Evaluation to provide information as a basis for making concrete recommendations, and planning for improving routine immunization activities to improve coverage rates and reduce equity barriers to immunisation services at the natioanl, governoratres and districtes levels.

comment.narrative: The ministry of health and UNICEF are undertaking a comprehensive costing exercise for PHC include immunisation. Instead of conducting a separate costing study for immunisation, a costing for integrated package will be more useful for the programme. concept note and tools for the costing study have been developed already and shared with MoH relevant department and have been oriented on them. The actual work on the study is in progress.

title.narrative: Country and regional guideline on solarization of facilities based on lessons learned from Gavi exceptional support available.

target.value: Technical support to ensure smooth transition from 2017-2019 Gavi exceptional support: i) documentation of vaccine, cold chain and solarization support; ii) Support cold chain inventory, iii) Guidance note on solarization of facilities; iv) Vaccine Supply Stock Management (VSSM) and timely projections

comment.narrative: ? The documents are complete as attached and edited from the external editors. However, the next step is to prepare for the launch of the report.

title.narrative: WHO : Supply Chain & Procurement
wVSSM functioning

target.value: wVSSM system installation, training and follow up (Pending government approval)

comment.narrative: wVSSM system already installed in Dec 2020, staff at central and governorate levels trained. Refresher training and installation at governorate level is planned in Q3.
